knimeNode.name: Row Filter
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows filtering of datarows by certain criteria, like row ID, attribute value, and row number range.

fullDescription.intro: The node allows for row filtering with certain criterias. It can include or exclude certain ranges (by row number), include or exclude rows with a certain row ID, and in- or exclude rows with a certain value in a selectable column (attribute). Below are the steps to configure the node in its configuration dialog.

option.name: In- or exclude rows by criteria

fullDescription.option: First, on the left hand side, select which criteria should be used for filtering. Also choose whether to include or exclude rows by the selected criteria. Depending on the choice the filter parameters in the panel on the right hand side need to be adjusted

If filter by attribute value is selected, select the column's name whose value should be matched. Then, either enter a regular expression for string matching, or a value range, for range filtering. When using a regular expression, a check mark can be set, if a case sensitive match is desired. If a range is specified, it is possible to specify only one boundary, the other is then set to (plus or minus) infinity.

If filter by range is selected, specify the first row number to in/exclude. The end of the range can either be specified by row number, or set to the end of the table, causing all remaining rows to be in/excluded then.

If filter by row key is selected, specify a regular expression, which is matched against the row ID of each row. A check mark can be set, if a case sensitive match should be performed and if the row ID must start with the specified pattern.

ports.dataOut: Datatable with rows meeting the specified criteria
